content.description: From Michael Hartman's guide :  "The crack starts around 12 feet from the corner. Climb the crack through the crux and then easy climbing to the top."
content.protection: Also from Michael Hartman's guide : "Protection â€“ nuts and cams, though no placements at the crux; top-rope."

content.description: Start at the corner of the buttress. Stay left as you work your way into a bulging corner, pull up into the corner on massive holds, skirt around the bulge onto easier terrain above. Crux is at the bottom establishing yourself onto corner.
content.protection: Nothing over a C4 #1 was placed. Good Stances for gear.
content.location: Climb is the northwest corner of the buttress. 2 feet climber's left of Northwest Buttress Direct

content.description: Start about 2 feet to the right of the corner. Arete is off.
content.protection: To set up top-rope, climb up the side of the rock to the left, but be careful! Nice drop-off. For TR anchors use boulders/rocks at top.

content.description:
Large dirty crack on the NW Buttress. Follow the vertical crack to its end then make a short scramble to the top. 

  Fun & well protected climbing
content.protection: Build gear anchor at the top or sling the little trees. Some bigger gear C4 or C5 is helpful.
content.location: Walk off the top following the trail & scramble down.

content.description: Cruxy start, smaller holds that get better.
content.protection: Small vertical placements in the dihedral. Alien, X4, C4 < .5
content.location: Natural anchors on top are set back from the face. Protect your rope over the edge. Rap down on a small tree climber's left on the ledge.

content.description: The start is the same as Ivy League. Follow the large vertical crack until you come to a crack on your right. Follow this crack to the corner. Climb the corner to the to top.
content.protection: Build gear anchor or sling the little trees. G rated. Good gear - standard rack.
content.location: Follow the trail and walk off & down scramble.

content.description: This is the first climbable area you see to the left as you walk in from the parking area at the base of Chickies Hill Road.
